newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil gains with futures, prems steady to up.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil gains with futures, prems steady to up.

text.p: NWE gas oil gained ground on Thursday, bolstered by steady to firmer premiums and stronger futures.
May IPE gas oil, which expires on Monday, closed $1.50 a tonne stronger at $169.00 while the June contract also moved higher gaining $1.00 to $167.50.
Trade was muted because of public holidays throughout Europe although bits and pieces were concluded, traders said.
A Russian cargo was sold cif into Hamburg at June IPE +$4.25 for 10-20 May dates while DIN was pegged around June IPE +$5 cif.
Dealers said interest in FOD was still very slow.
One dealer said that "0.2 pct can only be used for heating now compared with last year when it had an automotive application so the demand should be lower in the summer."

There was talk that one or two parcels of EN590 had been done, but confirmation was lacking. Suggestions that premiums were around June IPE +$13 cif were discounted by most dealers who said +$11-12 was a more realistic number.
